hanzi-su-wiki:
蔵

Значения

Склад; имущество

Мнемоника

Искажено. Внизу — министр 臣, доска 爿 и алебарда 戈 в значении «раболепие чиновников, боящихся государева гнева». В целом — прятать, хранить, склад. Раболепствующий, т.е. ползущий по земле человек без труда спрячется в траве 艹.

Варианты

藏
purpleculture_pinyin:
cáng
Japanese variant of 藏
Японский вариант тибетского
rtega_mnemonic:
藏藏RS
蔵蔵		𫟖hide, conceal, hoard, store up
  • subject 臧 hidden under grass 艹
koohiiStory1: The storehouse is overgrown with slaves. The slaves are to be sold in the store, to differentiate from a warehouse, which doesn´t have the word "store" in it.
koohiiStory2: Slaves moved flowers from the storehouse in preparation for the parade.
kunYomi: くら、おさ.める、かく.れる
jp_example_words:
蔵(くら): warehouse, cellar, magazine, granary, godown, depository, treasury, elevator
蔵相(ぞうしょう): Minister of Finance
埋蔵(まいぞう): buried property, treasure trove
冷蔵(れいぞう): cold storage, refrigeration
貯蔵(ちょぞう): storage, preservation
冷蔵庫(れいぞうこ): refrigerator
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The storehouse radical and the storehouse kanji meanings are the same. If you know the radical, you know the kanji!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Your brain is like a storehouse, you know? Hopefully that's where you kept your storehouse knowledge.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have a storehouse. Inside is where you keep all your zombies (ぞう).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Be really proud of your storehouse. You've collected a lot of zombies and put them in there, where they'll keep fresh a long time!
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 艾 (мокса), 戈 (копьё), 臣 (вассал)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the subject (臣) is overgrown (茂) because he's in the storehouse
